thread.title: Guns N' Roses announcer confuses Melbourne with Sydney at MCG concert
thread.title_full: Guns N' Roses announcer confuses Melbourne with Sydney at MCG concert

author: Timna Jacks, Martin Boulton
title: Guns N' Roses announcer confuses Melbourne with Sydney at MCG concert
text:
Guns N' Roses announcer confuses Melbourne with Sydney at MCG concert Timna Jacks, Martin Boulton twitter TWEET More 
Rock band Guns N' Roses has been been booed at their concert on Tuesday night after an announcer greeted the MCG crowd as "Sydney". 
A crowd already restless after waiting nearly an hour for the band's appearance replaced roaring cheers with a chorus of boos when they heard the slip up. SHARE Guns N' Roses frontman Axl Rose performs in Brisbane on February 7. Photo: Robert Shakespeare 
The core original members of Axl Rose, Slash and Duff McKagan bounded on stage with the rest of the band undaunted, while the 70,000 strong crowd seemed a little bemused. 
"You're in Melbourne," yelled one crowd member as the rockers burst into opening song Easy and fireworks lit up the stage. 
Audience members have also complained about poor sound quality at the concert, the band's first Melbourne performance since their notorious 1993 Calder Park concert. 
The concert is now trending on Twitter, with dozens of audience members venting their frustration at the blunder. Guns n Roses think they're in Sydney and the people next to us just left coz it's too loud hxbdvdbdbd im screaming
